snippet: The report exposes the perils of a deal reached last month that allows Greece to send migrants back to Turkey, and reflects shifting attitudes toward refugees in the countries bordering Syria.

byline.contributor: Ceylan Yeginsu contributed reporting from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: The report exposes the perils of a deal reached last month that allows Greece to send migrants back to Turkey, and reflects shifting attitudes toward refugees in the countries bordering Syria.

headline.main: Turkey Has Forcibly Returned Thousands of Refugees to Syria, Amnesty International Says

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
